arena

Class Terrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • arena.Terrain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stackable

    public class Terrain
extends java.lang.Object
implements Stackable
    Hexagonal Terrain
    Virtual hexagon defined by its type and appearence. It is able to hold over it one scenario and one item. (May be invisible by fog war).
    Author:
    Karina Suemi Awoki, Renato Cordeiro Ferreira, Vinicius Nascimento Silva
    See Also:
    scenario, stackable.item

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Terrain(int nPlayers, Appearence appearence)
      Default constructor
      Creates a terrain with a given appearence, defining its type accordingly to it.
      Terrain(int nPlayers, Appearence a, Item item)
      Secondary constructor
      Does the same as the default, aditionaly putting an item on the terrain.
      Terrain(int nPlayers, Appearence a, Scenario s)
      Secondary constructor
      Does the same as the default, aditionaly putting a scenario on the terrain.
      Terrain(int nPlayers, Appearence a, Scenario s, Item i)
      Secondary constructor
      Does the same as the default, aditionaly putting a scenario and an item on the terrain.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Terrain

        public Terrain(int nPlayers,
       Appearence appearence)
        Default constructor
        Creates a terrain with a given appearence, defining its type accordingly to it. Also, keeps a bitmap with the war fog.
        Parameters:
        nPlayers - Number of players
        appearence - Terrain appearence

        s - Scenario
